title: How to Make Lemon Poppy Seed Pancakes

steps.headline: In a bowl, mix the sugar and lemon zest between your fingers.
steps.description: Grate the lemon in a small bowl and add the two tablespoons of sugar. Instead of mixing with a spoon, use your fingers to crush the lemon zest and sugar with your fingers.

steps.headline: Pour in all the dry ingredients in another bowl.
steps.description: Whisk until all the ingredients are combined well.

steps.headline: Whisk up all the wet ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Beat well because there are egg yolks in there and they need to blended well.

steps.headline: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Whisk as hard as you can, trying to make the flour streaks disappear. It's alright to have a few bumps in the pancake batter, so long as there aren't too much.

steps.headline: Add in your two tablespoons of poppy seeds.
steps.description: Add those in your batter and give it a good stir.

steps.headline: Pour in your lemon and sugar mixture.
steps.description: Time to go sour! Add in your lemon and sugar mixture that you left aside earlier. Stir until the mixture is combined well.

steps.headline: Have the pancake batter rest.
steps.description: It should take about ten minutes for it to do so. Having it set aside helps the batter to be creamy and help the pancakes cook better. It may even make your pancakes fluffy!

steps.headline: Preheat your stove top while the batter sets.
steps.description: Put your stove on to medium and prepare a saucepan. Spread vegetable oil over it to prevent pancakes from sticking to the pan while cooking.

steps.headline: Cook the pancakes.
steps.description: Scoop in about 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto your pan. Once you start to see the edges brown, flip the pancakes slowly. Give flipping and cooking pancakes until your batter is done.

steps.headline: Serve pancakes on a plate.
steps.description: Get your helping and serve it on a plate.

text: In a bowl, mix the sugar and lemon zest between your fingers. Grate the lemon in a small bowl and add the two tablespoons of sugar. Instead of mixing with a spoon, use your fingers to crush the lemon zest and sugar with your fingers. Pour in all the dry ingredients in another bowl. Whisk until all the ingredients are combined well. Whisk up all the wet ingredients in a separate bowl. Beat well because there are egg yolks in there and they need to blended well. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Whisk as hard as you can, trying to make the flour streaks disappear. It's alright to have a few bumps in the pancake batter, so long as there aren't too much. Add in your two tablespoons of poppy seeds. Add those in your batter and give it a good stir. Pour in your lemon and sugar mixture. Time to go sour! Add in your lemon and sugar mixture that you left aside earlier. Stir until the mixture is combined well. Have the pancake batter rest. It should take about ten minutes for it to do so. Having it set aside helps the batter to be creamy and help the pancakes cook better. It may even make your pancakes fluffy! Preheat your stove top while the batter sets. Put your stove on to medium and prepare a saucepan. Spread vegetable oil over it to prevent pancakes from sticking to the pan while cooking. Cook the pancakes. Scoop in about 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto your pan. Once you start to see the edges brown, flip the pancakes slowly. Give flipping and cooking pancakes until your batter is done. Serve pancakes on a plate. Get your helping and serve it on a plate. Enjoy with maple syrup.
